Docs.param: The desired placement of the object, as defined by the constants in this class.
The horizontal size of the object.
The vertical size of the object.
The frame of the containing space, in which the object will be placed. Should be large enough to contain the width and height of the object.
Receives the computed frame of the object in its container.
Docs.summary: Apply a gravity constant to an object.

remarks.para: Apply a gravity constant to an object. This supposes that the layout direction is LTR.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Apply (Android.Views.GravityFlags gravity, int w, int h, Android.Graphics.Rect container, int xAdj, int yAdj, Android.Graphics.Rect outRect);

.method public static hidebysig void Apply(valuetype Android.Views.GravityFlags gravity, int32 w, int32 h, class Android.Graphics.Rect container, int32 xAdj, int32 yAdj, class Android.Graphics.Rect outRect) cil managed

Docs.param: The desired placement of the object, as defined by the constants in this class.
The horizontal size of the object.
The vertical size of the object.
The frame of the containing space, in which the object will be placed. Should be large enough to contain the width and height of the object.

Offset to apply to the X axis. If gravity is LEFT this pushes it to the right; if gravity is RIGHT it pushes it to the left; if gravity is CENTER_HORIZONTAL it pushes it to the right or left; otherwise it is ignored.
Offset to apply to the Y axis. If gravity is TOP this pushes it down; if gravity is BOTTOM it pushes it up; if gravity is CENTER_VERTICAL it pushes it down or up; otherwise it is ignored.
Receives the computed frame of the object in its container.
Docs.summary: Apply a gravity constant to an object.

remarks.para: Apply a gravity constant to an object.

a.href: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/Gravity.html#apply(int, int, int, android.graphics.Rect, int, int, android.graphics.Rect)

Offset to apply to the X axis. If gravity is LEFT this pushes it to the right; if gravity is RIGHT it pushes it to the left; if gravity is CENTER_HORIZONTAL it pushes it to the right or left; otherwise it is ignored.
Offset to apply to the Y axis. If gravity is TOP this pushes it down; if gravity is BOTTOM it pushes it up; if gravity is CENTER_VERTICAL it pushes it down or up; otherwise it is ignored.
Receives the computed frame of the object in its container.
The layout direction.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ApplyDisplay (Android.Views.GravityFlags gravity, Android.Graphics.Rect display, Android.Graphics.Rect inoutObj);
.method public static hidebysig void ApplyDisplay(valuetype Android.Views.GravityFlags gravity, class Android.Graphics.Rect display, class Android.Graphics.Rect inoutObj) cil managed

Docs.param: Gravity constants to modify the placement within the display.
The rectangle of the display in which the object is being placed.
Supplies the current object position; returns with it modified if needed to fit in the display.
Docs.summary: Apply additional gravity behavior based on the overall "display" that an object exists in.

remarks.para: Apply additional gravity behavior based on the overall "display" that an object exists in. This can be used after to place the object within a visible display. By default this moves or clips the object to be visible in the display; the gravity flags and can be used to change this behavior.

By default this moves or clips the object to be visible in the display; the gravity flags and can be used to change this behavior.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Views.GravityFlags GetAbsoluteGravity (Android.Views.GravityFlags gravity, Android.Views.GravityFlags layoutDirection);
.method public static hidebysig valuetype Android.Views.GravityFlags GetAbsoluteGravity(valuetype Android.Views.GravityFlags gravity, valuetype Android.Views.GravityFlags layoutDirection) cil managed

Docs.param: The gravity to convert to absolute (horizontal) values.
The layout direction.
Docs.summary: if horizontal direction is LTR, then START will set LEFT and END will set RIGHT. if horizontal direction is RTL, then START will set RIGHT and END will set LEFT.

remarks.para: if horizontal direction is LTR, then START will set LEFT and END will set RIGHT. if horizontal direction is RTL, then START will set RIGHT and END will set LEFT.
Convert script specific gravity to absolute horizontal value.

.property instance native int ThresholdClass

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
